definition: square/power or involution (math.)/upright/honest/fair and square/direction/side/party (to a contract, dispute etc)/place/method/prescription (medicine)/just when/only or just/classifier for square things/abbr. for square or cubic meter
lump (of earth)/chunk/piece/classifier for pieces of cloth, cake, soap etc/(coll.) classifier for money and currency units
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China

sentences.english: Lively and cute characters, bearing the success or failure of the Chinese nation.
sentences.chinese: 活泼可爱的方块字，承载了中华民族的兴衰成败。

sentences.english: The foreign students feel it a headache to learn Chinese characters.
sentences.chinese: 这使外国留学生学汉语方块字时感到头疼。

sentences.english: There is even fear of an unstated intention to replace Chinese characters totally, eventually.
sentences.chinese: 部分人士还担心有一天方块字会被汉语拼音完全取代。

sentences.english: These picture-words changed over time until they became square characters.
sentences.chinese: 这些图画文字经过演变就成了现在的方块字。

sentences.english: Don't you feel the irresistible charm of Chinese words?
sentences.chinese: 方块字那股难以抗拒的魅力，你不感觉到吗？

definition: Chinese character/CL:個|个[ge4]/Japanese: kanji/Korean: hanja/Vietnamese: hán tự
old character/archaic form of a Chinese character
the small or lesser seal, the form of Chinese character standardized by the Qin dynasty
pictogram (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/Chinese character derived from a picture/sometimes called hieroglyph
variant of 筆畫|笔画[bi3 hua4]
the great seal/used narrowly for 籀文/used broadly for many pre-Qin scripts
old language/the Classics/Classical Chinese as a literary model, esp. in Tang and Song prose/Classical Chinese as a school subject
